title: Bad Bunny - Tití Me Preguntó (Video Oficial) | Un Verano Sin Ti

lyrics.text: Qué lindo está Ese nene de Titi Mira qué
lyrics.explanation: The line captures a familial and affectionate tone, as 'Titi' is a colloquial term for 'aunt' in Puerto Rican Spanish, indicating a close family relationship.

lyrics.text: grande tú estás tú tienes muchas novias
lyrics.explanation: The aunt comments on the boy's growth and jokingly suggests he has many girlfriends, highlighting a common cultural trope of teasing young boys about romantic interests.

lyrics.text: verdad cuántas novias tú tienes Titi Yo
lyrics.explanation: The aunt continues the playful questioning about the number of girlfriends, which is a lighthearted way to engage with children in conversation.

lyrics.text: tengo como tres novia en la escuela cómo
lyrics.explanation: The boy humorously responds, exaggerating about having three girlfriends at school, reflecting childhood innocence and the playfulness of the conversation.

lyrics.text: es Mira a ver que te doy un chanet
lyrics.explanation: The word 'chanet' is likely a playful or made-up term, in line with the teasing and jocular nature of the exchange.

lyrics.text: e Titi me preguntó si tengo mucha
lyrics.explanation: The line introduces the recurring theme of the song, where Titi (aunt) asks if he has many girlfriends. This sets up the main narrative of romantic escapades that follows.

lyrics.text: novia mucha novia hoy Tengo a una mañana
lyrics.explanation: The singer admits to having multiple girlfriends, emphasizing the number and the casual nature of these relationships.

lyrics.text: otra e pero no hay boda Titi me preguntó
lyrics.explanation: Despite having many romantic partners, there is no intention of marriage, highlighting a carefree and non-committal attitude towards relationships.

lyrics.text: si tengo mucha
lyrics.explanation: Continuation of the aunt's questioning about the number of girlfriends, reinforcing the main theme of the song.

lyrics.text: novia mucha novia hoy Tengo a una mañana
lyrics.explanation: Repetition of the previous lines to emphasize the abundance of relationships and the routine nature of changing partners.

lyrics.text: otra
lyrics.explanation: The short line reinforces the pattern of having different partners each day, underscoring the transient nature of these relationships.

lyrics.text: llevar la todas para un VIP un VIP Ey
lyrics.explanation: The singer boasts about taking all his girlfriends to a VIP section, suggesting a lifestyle of luxury and exclusivity.

lyrics.text: saluden a ti ti vamos a tirar un selfie
lyrics.explanation: The act of taking a selfie in a VIP setting is a modern cultural reference to capturing and sharing moments of perceived importance or status.

lyrics.text: se e que sonrían la que le metí en un
lyrics.explanation: Encourages the girlfriends to smile for the photo, adding a layer of performative happiness in these public displays.

lyrics.text: VIP un VIP e saluden a ti ti vamos a
lyrics.explanation: Repetition of the earlier lines reinforces the glamorous lifestyle and the importance of social media in modern relationships.

lyrics.text: tirar un selfie sees que sonrían las que
lyrics.explanation: The insistence on smiling for selfies highlights the superficial aspects of these relationships.

lyrics.text: ya Se olvidaron de mí me gustan mucho
lyrics.explanation: The line suggests that despite the many relationships, they are fleeting, as some partners have already forgotten him.

lyrics.text: las gabrielas las Patricia las Nicole La
lyrics.explanation: Listing names personalizes the narrative, illustrating the variety and number of girlfriends.

lyrics.text: Sofía mi primera novia en kinder María y
lyrics.explanation: Mentions of kindergarten relationships add a nostalgic and humorous touch, reflecting on how these patterns started in childhood.

lyrics.text: mi primer amor se llama B talía tengo
lyrics.explanation: Refers to his first love, which contrasts with the superficial relationships discussed, adding depth to the narrative.

lyrics.text: una colombiana que me escribe todos los
lyrics.explanation: Mentions of a Colombian partner highlight the geographic diversity of his relationships.

lyrics.text: días y una mexicana que ni yo sabía otra
lyrics.explanation: The surprise at having a Mexican girlfriend he wasn't aware of underscores the casual and disconnected nature of these interactions.

lyrics.text: en San Antonio que me quier todavía y
lyrics.explanation: Continues the theme of long-distance and varied relationships.

lyrics.text: las dpr que todita son mías una
lyrics.explanation: The mention of 'DPR' (Dominican Republic) emphasizes the international scope of his romantic life.

lyrics.text: dominicana que juga bombón uba uba
lyrics.explanation: References a Dominican partner and 'bombón,' a term of endearment or slang for something sweet or attractive.

lyrics.text: bombón la de Barcelona que vino en avión
lyrics.explanation: The Barcelona girlfriend arriving by plane suggests a lifestyle of travel and international connections.

lyrics.text: y dice que mi dicho está cabrón yo dejo
lyrics.explanation: The use of 'cabrón' here is a slang term meaning something impressive or cool, indicating the girlfriend is impressed by him.

lyrics.text: que jueguen con mi corazón Quisiera
lyrics.explanation: Acknowledges that his heart is played with, hinting at the emotional risks of his lifestyle.

lyrics.text: mudarme con todas por una mansión el día
lyrics.explanation: A fantastical idea of living with all his partners in one mansion, illustrating a humorous and exaggerated view of his romantic life.

lyrics.text: que me cases te envío la invitación
lyrics.explanation: Promises an invitation to his wedding, despite the unlikely nature of such a commitment given his lifestyle.

lyrics.text: muchacho deja eso e Titi me preguntó si
lyrics.explanation: 'Muchacho deja eso' is likely advice to abandon this lifestyle, emphasizing the song's recurring theme of non-commitment.

lyrics.text: tengo muchas
lyrics.explanation: Continuation of the aunt's questioning theme about many girlfriends.

lyrics.text: novia muchas novia hoy tengo una mañana
lyrics.explanation: Reiterates the pattern of having multiple partners and the temporary nature of these relationships.

lyrics.text: otra e pero no hay me preguntó si tengo
lyrics.explanation: The repetition highlights the main theme of the song—numerous and fleeting relationships without serious commitment.

lyrics.text: mucha novia e e mucha novia hoy tengo
lyrics.explanation: The emphasis on numerous girlfriends continues, reinforcing the carefree lifestyle portrayed.

lyrics.explanation: Repetition of having a different partner each day.

lyrics.text: preguntó me
lyrics.explanation: Continues the theme of questioning about romantic life.

lyrics.text: pregun me
lyrics.explanation: Further reinforces the song's main thematic element.

lyrics.text: pregun Pero ven acá muchach para que tú
lyrics.explanation: Starts a rhetorical questioning about the need for so many girlfriends.

lyrics.text: quieres tanta novia me voy levar to un
lyrics.explanation: Questions the necessity of having so many partners, leading into the VIP lifestyle narrative.

lyrics.text: selfie que sonrían las que ya olvidaron
lyrics.explanation: Suggests some girlfriends have already forgotten him, highlighting the transient nature of these relationships.

lyrics.text: de mí Oye muchacho el azaroso
lyrics.explanation: 'Azaroso' is a slang term for someone who is reckless or living without care, which fits the narrative of the song.

lyrics.text: sutese vivir que tú tienes en la calle
lyrics.explanation: References a carefree lifestyle, living in the streets, further emphasizing the nonchalant attitude.

lyrics.text: Búscate una mujer seria para tio el
lyrics.explanation: Advice to find a serious relationship, contrasting with the singer's current lifestyle.

lyrics.text: pero no
lyrics.explanation: The singer admits to not being able to commit to such advice.

lyrics.text: puedo pero no
lyrics.explanation: Repetition of the inability to form a serious relationship.

lyrics.text: puedo Yo quisiera enamor alma pero no
lyrics.explanation: Expresses a desire to fall in love sincerely but acknowledges an inability to do so.

lyrics.text: puedo pero no puedo Sorry Yo no confío
lyrics.explanation: The singer's lack of trust in himself and in others is a barrier to forming meaningful relationships.

lyrics.text: Yo no confío n ni en mí mismo confío si
lyrics.explanation: Reaffirms the theme of mistrust, even towards himself.

lyrics.text: quieres quedarte hoy que hace frío y
lyrics.explanation: Offers a temporary connection due to the cold weather, suggesting transient comfort.

lyrics.text: mañana te vas n muchas quieren mi baby
lyrics.explanation: Many women are interested in him for superficial reasons, like having his child, emphasizing the transactional nature of these relationships.

lyrics.text: gry quieren tener mi primogénito e y
lyrics.explanation: Continues the theme of superficial interest in him for status or legacy.

lyrics.text: llevarse el crédito ya me aburr hoy
lyrics.explanation: He becomes bored with the superficial nature of these interactions.

lyrics.text: quiero un totito inédito e uno nuevo uno
lyrics.explanation: Expresses a desire for novelty in relationships, illustrating dissatisfaction with the current state.

lyrics.text: nuevo uno nuevo uno nuevo hazle caso a
lyrics.explanation: Repetition emphasizes the desire for something new and different.

lyrics.explanation: Admits that his behavior likely leads to heartbreak for partners.

lyrics.text: corazón e No te enamores de mí No te
lyrics.explanation: Warns others not to fall in love with him, as he is aware of his inability to commit.

lyrics.text: enamores de mí Sor Yo soy así e no sé
lyrics.explanation: Acknowledges his nature is not conducive to serious relationships and expresses confusion or acceptance of this fact.

lyrics.text: por qué soy así hazle caso a tu amiga

structuredSections.title: Intro
structuredSections.sectionExplanation: The introduction features an exchange between the artist and a family member, setting up the song's theme of numerous romantic relationships through playful conversation and cultural references to family dynamics.

structuredSections.title: Chorus
structuredSections.sectionExplanation: The chorus emphasizes the recurring theme of having many girlfriends, with a carefree attitude towards commitment and relationships, highlighting the artist's nonchalant lifestyle.

structuredSections.title: Verse 1
structuredSections.sectionExplanation: This verse delves into the artist's various relationships, listing numerous women from different backgrounds, showcasing the diversity and superficial nature of these connections.

structuredSections.title: Chorus
structuredSections.sectionExplanation: The chorus repeats, reinforcing the main theme of the song with its catchy hook about having many girlfriends and the lack of serious commitment.

structuredSections.title: Bridge
structuredSections.sectionExplanation: The bridge reflects on the artist's internal thoughts and feelings about his lifestyle, revealing a desire for change but recognizing personal limitations and mistrust.

structuredSections.title: Outro
structuredSections.sectionExplanation: The outro concludes with a reflection on the artist's nature and a wish to change, leaving the listener with a sense of introspection and unresolved tension about personal growth.
